results.title: Csironet
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Today computers have many more applications outside science than in it. The result has been another information revolution. CSIRONET is CSIRO’s nationwide computer network, linking remote units to the Cyber 76, the most powerful computer in the southern hemisphere. This film shows some applications of the computer and the network.

results.title: Moss: nature's metal detector
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Reports on the natural ability of Sphagnum moss to measure air-borne particles of heavy metals.

results.title: A New way of looking for tuna
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Southern blue fin tuna schools are attracted to water with a particular surface temperature. Marine scientists use aircraft to map sea surface isotherms and pinpoint these places for the fishermen. The result is increased catches.

results.title: New uses for coal waste
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
At the present level of coal usage a mountainous 15 million tonnes of waste is left behind every year after the coal is washed. Most of the waste is a coarse coal-bearing shale which is dumped in slag heaps. A program to reduce and utilise the waste from coal washeries has come up with far-reaching economic possibilities. The film looks at these possibilities.

results.title: Fighting fire with fire
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Focuses on the research CSIRO have undertaken to understand wind, the most complex of environmental factors associated with bushfires. Sometimes exceeding 150 kilometres an hour, these winds can uproot huge trees, throwing them about like matches.

results.title: Quest for a better battery
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Although petrol saving electric vehicles are making something of a comeback, they suffer from one major drawback, namely the poor performance of conventional lead acid batteries. Researchers at CSIRO’s Division of Mineral Chemistry are working to improve the performance of lead acid batteries made with nickel zinc or lithium plates.

results.title: Landscapes from space
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Landsat data being processed by CSIRO are revealing a new picture of mineral areas, the environment, agriculture and land use planning in Western Australia.

results.title: Molecules in outer space
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Radio astronomers scan the skies with the giant Parkes radio telescope in search of radio signals from molecules. They are looking for evidence pointing to the existence of life in space or to the conditions under which life forms could develop.

results.title: New twists on ocean currents
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Fibreglass buoys floating in the ocean are used to track the huge ocean currents off the coast of New South Wales. The buoys are proving highly reliable in supplying insights into the so-called East Australian currents.

results.title: Australia's most expensive tick
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Extensive research is uncovering a great deal of information about the cattle tick which costs the beef industry of Northern Australia millions of dollars each year.
